description: Outbreak or escalation of armed conflict in a country hosting critical suppliers, manufacturing facilities, or sourcing operations, causing supply disruption, facility damage, or inability to operate.
Imposition of comprehensive or targeted international sanctions, trade embargoes, or economic restrictions affecting ability to conduct business with sanctioned entities, countries, or sectors.
Government seizure or forced nationalization of foreign-owned assets, facilities, or operations, either through outright expropriation or de facto control measures.
Strikes, protests, riots, or civil unrest disrupting facilities, supply chains, or workforce availability for >48 hours, causing material operational impact.
Collapse of state institutions, regime change, or extreme political instability causing breakdown of rule of law, contract enforceability, or operational environment.

data_sources.name: Fund for Peace Fragile States Index

description: Armed territorial disputes, contested borders, or sea lane control issues disrupting trade routes, energy corridors, or supply chain access.
Large-scale military mobilization, conscription, or reserve call-ups removing significant workforce from operations in conflict or near-conflict zones.
Imposition of tariffs exceeding 25% on significant trade volumes, affecting cost structure, competitiveness, or market access for EU businesses.
Government-imposed restrictions on exporting critical technologies, dual-use goods, or strategic materials, limiting market access or requiring costly compliance.

data_sources.name: US BIS (Bureau of Industry and Security)

description: Government-imposed restrictions on currency convertibility, capital repatriation, foreign exchange access, or cross-border payments, impeding financial operations.
Termination, suspension, or non-renewal of bilateral/multilateral trade agreements, resulting in loss of preferential market access, tariff increases, or regulatory barriers.
New or tightened import quotas, licensing requirements, or quantitative restrictions limiting ability to import goods or requiring costly compliance processes.
Sanctions imposed on key business partners (customers, suppliers, partners) requiring immediate relationship termination and causing supply/revenue disruption.
New or significantly tightened environmental regulations on emissions (GHG, air quality), waste management, circular economy, or pollution control, requiring operational changes or investments.
New or expanded data protection/privacy regulations similar to GDPR, requiring significant compliance investments, operational changes, or restricting data use/transfers.
Changes to product safety standards, certification requirements, or testing protocols requiring product redesign, re-certification, or market withdrawals.
Significant changes to labor laws affecting wages, working hours, benefits, or employment rights, increasing labor costs or constraining operational flexibility.
Major changes to financial reporting standards (e.g., IFRS), tax codes, transfer pricing rules, or anti-avoidance measures, requiring system changes and potentially increasing tax burdens.
Mandatory supply chain due diligence requirements (human rights, environmental, conflict minerals) requiring transparency, audits, and potential supplier changes.
New restrictions on chemicals, materials, or substances (similar to REACH, RoHS) requiring product reformulation, alternative sourcing, or market withdrawals.
Recession in major market (GDP contraction >2%)
Banking crisis or credit crunch
Currency devaluation (>30% vs. USD/EUR)

data_sources.name: IMF Currency Composition of Official Foreign Exchange Reserves
Bank for International Settlements FX Market Statistics
European Central Bank Statistical Data Warehouse

description: Sovereign debt crisis
Inflation surge (>10% annually)

data_sources.name: Eurostat HICP (Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices)

description: Asset bubble burst (real estate, stocks)

data_sources.name: UBS Global Real Estate Bubble Index

description: Carbon pricing/tax implementation
Fossil fuel subsidy removal
Renewable energy mandates
Internal combustion engine phase-out

data_sources.name: EU CO2 Standards for Cars and Vans

description: Building energy efficiency requirements

data_sources.name: EU Energy Performance of Buildings Directive (EPBD)

description: Green hydrogen/ammonia transition
